messages.content: What type of models does ComfyUI-SegMoE support?
What are the key features of the SegMoE Generation node in ComfyUI-SegMoE?

The key features of the SegMoE Generation node are pipe (model connection), positivet and negative (positive and negative prompt words), step (steps, default is 30), guidance_scale (prompt word relevance, default is 5), width and height (width and height), and seed.
You can install ComfyUI-SegMoE using the ComfyUI Manager (soon to be released), or manually by cloning the repository and installing the requirements.
What are the prerequisites for running ComfyUI-SegMoE?
It is recommended to have at least 20GB of VRAM to run ComfyUI-SegMoE.
What is the typical workflow for using ComfyUI-SegMoE?
The workflow is defined in the [SegMoE V1.0](https://github.com/ZHO-ZHO-ZHO/ComfyUI-SegMoE/blob/main/SEGMOE%20WORKFLOWS/SegMoE%20V1.0%E3%80%90Zho%E3%80%91.json) file.
What is the latest version of ComfyUI-SegMoE?
The latest version of ComfyUI-SegMoE is V1.0.
What is the speed performance of V1.0 on an A100 GPU?
The V1.0 performance on an A100 GPU for 50 steps is 17 seconds.
Who is the primary contributor to the SegMoE model that ComfyUI-SegMoE is based on?
The primary contributor to the SegMoE model is [SegMind](https://github.com/segmind/segmoe).
